homeExemptions.postDeathTreatment: subject to recovery only if home passes through probate

recoveryTimeframes.statuteLimit: 6 months after death or probate notice

criteria: recovery would eliminate primary income source

incomeDisregards: incurred medical expenses may be used for spend-down eligibility

spousalProtections.jointPropertyTreatment: not subject to recovery while spouse is alive or if it avoids probate
additionalProtections: no recovery from surviving spouse's estate

administrative.agency: Illinois Department of Healthcare and Family Services (HFS), Estate Recovery Unit

programEffectiveness.estatesPursued: probate estates with real property or liquid assets

effectiveStrategies: avoid probate using revocable trusts, TOD deeds, or joint ownership
use beneficiary designations for financial accounts
use hardship waiver if heir would lose housing or income
leverage spend-down if over income threshold
